reviews.text: My husband, son and I just returned from a wonderful holiday at the Bahia Principe Punta Cana (March 26 - April 2).
reviews.title: A wonderful Vacation!!
Beautiful Resort and beach
reviews.text: We booked this trip back in November and I religiously checked the reviews of this site daily. Needless to say, I was concerned at the outset because there seemed to be quite a few not-so-nice reviews but let me tell you, those who wrote those were obviously not at the same resort!

I can appreciate that everyone is entitled to their opinion HOWEVER, the things that people seemed to complain about were par for the course for travelling in a third world country (food, language barrier).
reviews.title: Bad start, Great finish!
great resort
reviews.text: The resort was beautiful, well maintained and immaculate. In a few years time when the newly planted palm trees have matured a bit, it will be spectacular. We walked along the beach and had an opportunity to check out some of the other resorts on either side of the Bahia (Grand Paradise to the left and Iberostar to the right) and they did not compare to the Bahia.

reviews.title: Enjoyable Vacation
reviews.text: The staff were always eager to please....some were better at English than others but it made it fun! I would get very annoyed when I saw some guests get frustrated at staff for not being able to understand.

reviews.title: Wonderful getaway
reviews.text: Just returned from a four night stay at the Gran Bahia Principe. Went with a group of girlfriends. Everything from the check-in went smoothly. Our rooms were great (please note that we did upgrade to the club golden rooms). The rooms were large and very clean. The bathroom was very spacious with a large soaking tub.

There are many options for food and many bars. The food at the buffet was better than I expected. There were always lots of very good choices. The one drawback was the speciality dining. It left much to be desired. I would suggest that you just stick to the buffet for all of your meals. Also, would suggest that you bring your own wine because the local wines that they serve as a part of the all inclusive plan was of poor quality.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous Resort!

reviews.text: The staff was wonderful. They were friendly and always greeted you with a smile and seemed happy to see you.
reviews.title: Bahia Principe Bahia Principe, we love it
You are stupid not to go!
reviews.text: The beach and pools were fabulous. The beach was very clean with miles of white sand and always plenty of chairs.

reviews.title: Well worth it!
reviews.text: This property is very well maintained and staff was constantly keeping things clean. This is a hugh property but there was always a trolley to take you where you needed to go.

reviews.title: Had a great time, minus the little problems.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bahia Principe Nov. 7 -14. It was a very much anticipated trip and was fantastic minus a few problems. I will try and give as much detail as possible, because these reviews really helped me so much, so perhaps I may help someone else.

reviews.title: My Wedding
reviews.text: The airport was a breeze. I was really impressed by how quickly they seemed to manage everything. Especially for it being so small. The bus ride to the hotel was quite bumpy and I had a huge headache and felt a bit sick by the time I got to my hotel.

reviews.title: Very nice, but......
reviews.text: I felt much better as we unloaded into the lobby of the hotel. It was BEAUTIFUL! Everything is made of tile and marble, with these great sculptures and beautiful paintings. Everyone at the front desk was smiling and is definately alot slower than I am used to here in Chicago. We paid the $35 for the safe for the week and they wanted cash, I found it strange that they told me they don't accept credit cards for incidentals and such. So just be prepared for using cash there. AFter we received our keys we had a bellman take us to our room on this cart thing and he helped us carry our luggage upstairs.

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: The grounds are exquisit and perfectly manicured. And each building of villas looks like a postcard. Our building was #14 and we were on the second floor overlooking both pools in the middle of the property. I would have to say we were in the perfect location. We could walk to the lobby or the beach with about a 5 minute walk either way. Or you could walk right downstairs and catch a tram that was always running up and down the paths.

reviews.title: Stay away
reviews.text: Our room was stunning. I really didn't expect it to be so nice. 2 big beds and a couch. A table and chairs, mini fridge, patio with table and chairs (which had the most amazing view). Our mini fridge never seemed to get cold, which was a bummer cause I had to bring antibiotics for my son that were supposed to be kept cold. Our bathroom was big as well. Nice size jacuzzi tub, with this 1/2 wall of glass. Everything is stone, tile and marble. I know what everyone is speaking of now in these other reviews about how the bathroom gets so wet. Just be careful getting out of the tub/shower cause you can easily slip and fall.

We stayed at the Bahia from Feb. 25 to March 4. We booked 2 weeks ahead with Nolitours which is operated by Air Transat. The flight was great and the check-in was unexpected - we all got envelopes with our room keys and our bracelets on the bus that took us from the airport to the resort. I emailed the resort and got us a room in the Premier section - it is far from the beach, but we loved the location and we liked taking the shuttle back and forth (a 3-minute ride). The premier section is close to the gym/spa, has its own private pool with swim-up bar, its own restaurant and lobby, but we really did not care about all that. Our room was facing the pool and it was beautiful - the resort was overbooked so some people had no view!We had music all day long from the pool and I kinda liked that when I enjoyed my coffee on the balcony.
reviews.title: Got engaged on the beach in Punta Cana

reviews.text: Make sure you go to your information meeting in the morning - it's helpful.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort - definitely will return
First Class all the way
reviews.text: The room is beautiful and the maid was amazing. We left her a tip and some gifts every day - soap, candy, some cosmetics, etc. She always gave us extra bottles of water and pop, coffee,extra towels, extra rum bottles, T-shirts and she made nice creations witht towels and flowers.

reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous
reviews.text: I could write forever, but I will not bore you. The resort is amazing and we liked it. The lobbies, the grounds and the people are excellent. The truth is that DR is a third world country and you cannot drink the tap water - Please be careful and do not drink or brush your teeth with the tap water. Be careful with the salad bar and the vegetables - they must use the same water to wash them. They bring filtered water for the ice-cubes and the water they give you in the restaurants. Unfortunately, I got sick along with other Canadians/Americans we met. HOWEVER, when I left I was already sick with a fever and plus I have a sensitive stomach. If you go with an open mind and without worrying, you will have a great time. I THINK I READ TOO MANY REVIEWS AND WORRIED TOO MUCH...

The Beach is wonderful and the weather was great every single day. It rained only one night and on our departure day in the afternoon (we find it always rains on the last day of our trip....). You can walk till the end of the strip where there is a fleamarket and a little bar for refreshments ($). It's beautiful!
reviews.title: Just got back....

reviews.text: I travelled to this resort with my wife and 1 year old daughter from Dec 04-11, 2005 basing my choice on the reviews posted on this site. We all thoroughly enjoyed our vacation, with our goal being rest and relaxation.I hope you find these tips helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent resort!
brilliant!!!
reviews.text: AIRPORT:Baggage handlers not worth the expense as it is only about 200 feet from the luggage carousel to the hotel buses.

reviews.title: It was good but....
reviews.text: CHECK-IN:You can arrange a late check-out for US$10/hr. Useful if you have a late return flight.Room safe costs around US$5/day payable on check-in.

reviews.title: Fabulous vacation
reviews.text: ROOMS:All are junior suites in two story villas.Ground floor better if you have small kids as there are no stairs to climb.Jacuzzi tub and tiled floors in bathroom were nice touch. Very clean. Maid service was excellent.
GROUNDS:Resort is expansive and shuttles available to travel to beachside area. Spa/gym located across street from lobby.
reviews.title: Theft Alert!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My freind got married at this hotel and whilst the wedding went well, I was bumped to another hotel three days prior to my arrival even though I was best man at the wedding. To add insult, my wife and I had to pay a day fee of US$75 each to attend my friends wedding where I was best man!
reviews.title: Warning

likes.liked: — I can't comment as I didn't get as far as seeing the room I had booked and had confirmed

reviews.text: The hotel grossly overbook their hotel and we were told by a member of staff that the priority is for clients who booked through First Choice, anyone booking by expedia were effectively second class citizens and automatically tansfered elsewhere, and in most cases to three star accomodation.
reviews.title: Five Star - Not!!

reviews.text: We also met other couples who were bumped into other hotels and at our reckoning in the week we were there over 100 people had been transfered to other locations. This included another wedding party. The situation was so bad that there were posters at the venue asking people if they wanted to move into other hotels, with offers of up to $300 for people to do this.
reviews.title: Great entertainment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would seriously consider staying somewhere else and would strongly urge you to plan your wedding elsewhere.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Returned on April 27, 2008
reviews.title: great trip

likes.liked: — the beach, restaurant food, beautiful and clean resort, nightly shows
likes.disliked: — buffet food, massage on the beach

reviews.text: We just got back a couple of days ago and we are still dreaming of our wonderful vacation. This resort is beautiful and all the staff were wonderful. This was our first time to Punta Cana and when we do return, I can't imagine going to any other resort. The food was very good considering how many people they serve on a daily basis. We went to 6 of the a-la-carte restaurants...Italian was the best. The entertainment staff were wonderful. The evening entertainment was amazing..very professional. Our rooms were very clean. My main advice about the rooms, try to avoid the rooms near the environmental area. There is standing water in the bushes which can get very smelly at times. The pool is very clean and the beaches were amazing...you can walk for miles. We did have one bad experience which had nothing to do with the resort. My son and I booked a "sun-set" snorkeling tour with the company that operates all the water sports on the beaches. It was our last day of vacation and we wanted to do something special. After waiting an hour and getting fitted for our snorkeling equipment...which didn't seem very hygenic, we were told that the boat was full and we had to "re-schedule". Apparantely the sales agent sold the entire boat to a large family so we were bumped off. I had spoken to him the day before about this tour and he told me it was available. We purchased the tickets that morning and when it was time to leave for the excursion he lied to me by saying that the family had reserved it 3 days earlier...obviously a boat full of passengers(15 people) pays more commision than 2 people so we were bumped along with another family of 5. Although we did receive a refund, it wasted about 2 hous of our time on our last day when we could have maybe arranged some other tour. My 12 year old son was very dissapointed. I would not recommend booking anything with scuba caribe. They seem very disorganized and these would be the people you would be trusting with your life on the waters.
reviews.title: can't wait to go back!!

reviews.text: Having just returned from a weeks vacation at the Grand Bahia (March 7-14), I decided to answer some of the questions in Q&A format that previous reviews did not address and of course give you my throughts on the resort as a whole.
reviews.title: All You Need to Know

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Q1: Which area/rooms should I request?
reviews.title: Our Attitudes Determined Our Outcome!

likes.liked: — The room was HUGE, and we never felt claustrophobic. Lots of space.
likes.disliked: — Can't really think of anything, other than maybe too quiet at times...

reviews.text: The resort has 4 sections, the front section is for Club Golden - villa 1- 10 and 20-29 is up by the beach, pool, a restaurant that serves both lunch and breakfast, and a few snack bars. Villas 1, 2, 4, 23, 21, 20 are the closest, with villa 1 and 20 likely providing some views of the ocean if you are ocean side. Villas 3, 5, 6, 25, 24, 22 would also be good. The buildings are 2 and 3 storey high. We stayed here and found easy navigating during the day but took the trolley at night to the shows and lobby bar.
reviews.title: Helicopters flying overhead !

reviews.text: The middle section runs from 11-19, and 30 to 39. I would not want to stay in units 33, 35, 37, 39 as they back on to constuction. These units are half way between beach and the lobby.
reviews.title: A bit too full

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Gran Bahia for a week over Valentine's Day. I traveled with my boyfriend and a couple that we are close friends with. Overall, we had a terrific time! Since we relied upon the Trip Advisor reviews in booking our trip, I wanted to leave feedback about our experience.
reviews.title: Great Drinks, Beautiful Beach... Isn't that all you really need?

reviews.text: We booked our stay through cheapcaribbean.com, which provided our hotel transfers, flight, and hotel reservations. It turned out to be a good value for the quality of the trip. Cheap Caribbean was very easy to deal with and would definitely recommend using them.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!!!!

reviews.text: The hotel is near the airport (~20 min.) so transfers are a breeze.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.text: The hotel itself is beautiful, as many others have mentioned. But, it is so large and the layout is kind of confusing. It helped us to ride around on the trolley just to get a sense of where things were. In fact, by riding around, we found a pool on the punta cana side (?), near the villas in the 40’s, that was open to everyone. That pool had teak chairs with pads and was quieter, so we preferred that to the large pool. Of course, the only drawback is that it was not near the beach.
reviews.title: Wedding at Bahia Principe

likes.liked: — The grounds and the location were stunning...
likes.disliked: — Dealing with the staff, wedding planner.

reviews.title: Fantastic! We were very surprised as this is a true 5 star.
reviews.text: I put a question mark near the comment about the Punta Cana side because it is literally impossible to tell/remember which side is which. I’m not sure why they designed the property that way but really its fine, we hung out in both lobbies at different times.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I just returned from a fabulous week at Bahia Principe Bavaro Club Diamond. Let me say that we were a little apprehensive after our stay last December at the Bahia Principe Tulum in the Mayan Riviera. However, many friends at work raved about this place so we gave it a try.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation at the Club Diamond Bahia Principe Bavaro

likes.liked: — The beach, the food, the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to many all inclusives in Mexico and were previously at the Bavaro Princess in Punta Cana. The Bahia Principe Bavarro was the best place that we have stayed at. We never go to the same place twice but will now make an exception.
reviews.title: wonderful resort!!

reviews.text: The Club Diamond staff (Jacky, Gabriella and Raquel) was amazing. I emailed in advance requesting reservations at the seafood restaurant on my boyfriend's birthday. Not only did they arrange that, our room was also decorated on his birthday and the restaurant had a birthday cake for him! In addition, these ladies took care of all our requests (ie mattress pad, mini bar top up). They were terrific and made our week worry free.
reviews.title: Amazing Wedding and Vacation at the GBP

likes.liked: — The staff and the gorgeous beach - and our romantic dinner on the beach!

reviews.text: The food at this resort is amazing! As part of Club Diamond, we had ala carte lunch everyday at Il Capriccio and also had our breakfasts there. You had a choice of freshly made pastas, pizzas or meat /fish. We alternated between grilled salmon, grouper and mixed seafood along with a lovely salad bar. In addition, this restaurant is steps away from the Club Diamond pool and the Club Diamond rooms.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For dinner, we loved both El Pescador and The Grill. Both dinners were comparable to The Keg quality. The tenderloin beef steak at the Grill was fantastic and I have never had good steak at any all inclusive. The mixed seafood dinner at El Pescador was delicious. The main buffet also had great selections.
reviews.title: Way to big

reviews.text: We stayed at the Bahia Principe from March 25 - April 1st and loved it.
reviews.title: Great Choice! Would stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little concerned after reading some of the negative reviews on this website, but we had only positive encounters our entire stay. The resort is really big, which at first I did not think I would like (especially since it was at capacity - we thought it might be too crowded), but seeing as we were there for an entire week and never left the property it gave us plenty to explore and for people to spread out so it never seemed crowded. You do have to get a Beach or Pool chair early, but not at 7 am like others have posted. We got to the pool one day at 9am and found chairs without a problem, however, by 10 am they were almost all taken.
reviews.title: Nice and Clean, But it Stops There

reviews.text: The hotel grounds are beautiful, and very well maintained. There are multiple pools (all clean and beautiful) to chose from but the beach is probably the biggest draw... 28 miles of white sand and turquoise water... simply breathtaking, and fun to walk. Great people watching.
reviews.title: The Good, The Bad and The Ugly

likes.liked: — The friendly people that work there, the Mexican Resteraunt

reviews.text: There are several restaurants to chose from (we ate at the BBQ restaurant and thought it was 'okay' but the Japanese was our favorite!). The hotel buffet also has something for everyone. My wife is a professional chef (and very picky) and she thought the hotel did a wonderful job offering a variety of good foods to choose from. The coffee is excellent and the bartenders are pretty liberal with the amount of alcohol in the drinks :-)
reviews.title: Wonderful and Beautiful

reviews.text: Entertainment in the theater was a little amateurish, but I give them credit for trying. We saw two shows and one was great and the other was not... but if there is a great keyboard player and vocalist in the lobby bar until 11 which is a little nicer and much more sophisticated. We went to the Disco once (doesn't open until midnight)... and basically it's whatever you make of it. We had fun, but if you are looking for some serious nightlife, this is not it.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Bahia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will do my best to be fair. Considering if I wasn't there for my friends wedding, I would have left after day one. So lets start with check in. Do not bother arriving early to Punta Cana. Your room will not be ready, usually not before 3pm or in our case 4pm. You will enjoy the mid afternoon humidity in the main lobby. With only drinks to keep you busy for hours. Whats that you say, don't sound to bad. Ah until you get the pleasure of experiencing the worlds worst language barrier. It took me several attempts to order a Pina Colada with alcohol in it and I speak some ok spanish. Ok now for the fun stuff . We get to our room a quick change of clothes and off to the pool or beach. Nope every lounge chair pool side and beach front taken. The pool looked as if spring break was cancelled and rescheduled at this particular pool. Throw in 100 grumpy Canadians and 100 children for what was slowly becoming my worst nightmare. I then gave myself a mental coaching. Its not about me I am here for my friends wedding and hopefully for my much more easy going wife to enjoy time away. Alright two or three deep breaths later. My favorite time. Time to shower up from the beach which was beautiful, sand included and go to dinner. Here is the best part of my review the food was nothing short of well, how do I say this. Let me borrow an old saying "gag me with a spoon". It was really bad. With very few exceptions and I am speaking about the entire 7 days I was there. Maybe its just me so I surveyed the other 36 friends and family that also went to attend wedding. General consensus. On a scale of one through ten. About a 3. Ok some more cons before I reveal the few pros. The Resort is about the size of Texas give or take an acre. So pack your hiking shoes and patience. I needed both. There were two times I went back to my room from a sun filled day of beach and poolside drinking. Only to find out my magnetic key card no longer worked. Time for yet another chaffing mile hike to reactivate key card. Yes you can use a trolly but sometimes they are filled to max with Grumpy Canadians. How was the entertainment? Glad you asked. You have four options. First the Closet Casino. Small and they seem generally pissed if you win. At most times I felt security was waiting for a grand robbery to occur.They did some weird stuff here. You have to pay for drinks inside Casino and you can smoke but not cigars. Thank god we don't have access to really good cuban or dominican cigars! Spoiler Alert I'm being sarcastic .Second the Disco tech. Wow! The wonderful aroma of vomit and urine cut my visit to this bar down to about 15 minutes total for the entire trip. Third there is a Sports bar with Karaoke. Not too bad I enjoyed it. Only down fall, bar too small. Hard at times to get drinks. Last but not least the shows. I thought the Michael Jackson show was great. But unfortunatelly on most nights I did not have the hour lee way to reserve a seat for the other shows. Although my Friends told me they did catch one other show which was also good. Ok some other pros to my visit at Grand Bahia Principe Punta Cana. The staff where very nice and extremely hard workers. Although the language barrier was much harder then my visit to Mexico. The resort cleans From morning into late night. I even saw them sweeping the grass! Not kidding. They where painting and cleaning even in the dark. I was highly impressed with the attention to detail as far as cleanliness was concerned. Drinks where served promptly despite the million or so people that where at the resort. I also was relieved to see women removing the shackles that society tries to place on them. By forcing them to where tops at the pools and beaches in America. What a wonderful sight Boobies here, Boobies there, Boobies everywhere. To sum up the total experience The having to reserve a beach and or pool lounge chair at 7am coupled with the lack of night time activities and down right nasty food. Was too much to handle. I guess its true what they say misery likes company. If I didn't have other couples/friends there I would have had Apple Vaca switch my resorts or flown home. This was only my second all inclusive resort. It could not compare to Mexico. The food, entertainment , and general fun factor was way way below expectations when compared to Riviera Maya in Mexico. I also have done one cruise. Again this trip, not even close. Punta Cana was too disorganized and crowded. Hope this helps save some one from wasting they hard earned money and vacation time.
reviews.title: Punta Cana Boom!

reviews.text: Respect !
reviews.title: Great vaca!

reviews.text: The resort is gorgeous! The food was good, the beach was nice. The ala cartes were amazing! I prebooked before traveling. Most of the staff was amazing. The rooms were great. Things were expensive for trinkets but we just didn't buy them!
reviews.title: 3rd time and always amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great vaca all around!
reviews.title: Amazing place

reviews.text: Only drawback was the msoquitos. Never saw them during the day but they certainly found me I the night!
reviews.title: Great value in beautiful Punta Cana!

reviews.text: We just came back from this resort and we are depressive! It was fantastic. It's our third time in Punta Cana, but this was the best place we stayed. we were 13 friends between 25 and 35 years old and everyone loved this resort. It's a Big beautiful and clean resort. People are so nice, they will do everything to make your stay unforgettable. The room is big and confortable and so clean. We tip 2$ per day and we had flowers and extra bottle of water. The food was very good. The buffet is big and you will always find something to eat. We went to the restaurant a la carte. we tried sea food, french and the grill. our best was the french. i would never thought eat that well in DR. The animation was great, always something to do on the beach, stretching, aerobic, salsa, merengue, volley ball, soccer, kayaking etc. In the evening there is shows but we didn't went because we used to have supper late at night so we went to the pueblo principe, were was others shows, the disco and casino. I am telling you, this is the place to go in punta cana, don'T hesitate please and bring me back!!!! sorry for my english , i am a french canadian, from quebec...
reviews.title: i wanna go back now!!!!!

likes.liked: — the beach and the pueblo principe

reviews.title: The Disneyland of Punta Cana
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bahia from January 8th to the 23rd. This is an awesome hotel - the reviews on this website pretty much cover how consistantly good it is so I'll just make a couple of additional comments. We booked our 2 week trip to the Bahia with Air Canada Vacations on Sell-Off Vacations at a great price. The only drawback was that we had to fly from Vancouver and lay-over in Montreal on the way down which ended up horrible as none of our baggage made it to Punta Cana until our 6th day. Not to dwell on the negative, (if this was the how easy is it to contact Air Canada for compensation website this would have a different rating!) everyone at the hotel was great, but be forwarned that Air Canada won't ship your bags down with another carrier even if they don't have another flight to Punta Cana for 5 more days so pack your carry-ons well!

reviews.title: Thumbs up!
reviews.text: While we were there the resort was overbooked. We loved our room location (building 9 - peeka boo ocean and the Riu view )but risked giving it up to go on an all inclusive overnight excursion through the hotel to Saona Island and Santo Domingo. It was one of the highlights of our trip - even if we hadn't had the bonus of $200.00 US spending money given to us by the hotel. When we returned we were placed in the brand-new Club Golden section closest to the beach (Building 60) If they are still offering this excursion when you go don't worry - there is no "catch"!

reviews.title: We Are Going Back !!!!
reviews.text: This resort is a beauty. I travel a lot and I have seen a lot but nothing like this beautiful resort. I was amazed! Me and my husband absoulutely loved it. Some travel agencies rate the resort as four stars but it is five stars, and we agree. Since the rule of the island is that the higest building cannot be taller than tallest palm :) ther is no huge condominium like hotels but villa type resorts. We stayed in villa number 5-close to the beach (2 minutes walking) and close to the pool (one of tree big pools). The food was great. We ate mostly at the buffe but we also tried a'la carte restaurants. The service was superb. Staff was friendly and professional at all times. Our maid was very nice and she decorated our room with fresh flowers every day and slipped few times sweet treat for late night sweet tooth :))) We loved walking everywhere. The resort is very well maintened and extremely

clean! Everyday there was different entertainment. We just enjoyed listning to local music, sip drinks and relax! We were happy to stay closer to the beach than to lobby and theatre beacuse it was nice and quiet at nights. Around lobby there can be a lot of motion around evening time (entertainment and restaurants are located around lobby). If you like quiet atmosphere ask for villa closer to the beach. During the day it was also very quiet ,there was music at the beach but the beach is vey long so everybody could find comfortable spot. There were some children but not many and there was no screaming,crying or splashing :) As far as our roo goes we didn't spend much time in it but it was nice and decorated with local artwork. We also enjoyed few excursions away from the resort. We took a quad adventure tour and Saona island tour-the Saona island has the most beautiful beach I have ever seen. And the ride on tha catamaran to get there was just a dream.
reviews.title: Great Time... but Resort Too Big!

likes.liked: — great weather, Club Diamond upgrade ammenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: great a la carte restaurants, compared to what we have seen in other comparable Punta Cana hotels, the best in my opinion was the french restaurant, japanese was not bad, but we felt a little rushed in there and the rice was overcooked, the italian one is not bad, but really overrated. We had heard so much about it and had to wait till our last night there to eat in it, but it was not all that, the service, for example, was so much better at the french and mediterranean restaurants. The beach was really nice, as is typical for Punta Cana resorts. Since we do not really like the shows in Punta Cana, such as The Michael Jackson or other Cabaret style shows due to their poor quality, we really liked the fact that this hotel had a piano player in the hotel lobby every night, who sang really well, and we just sat there relaxed, drinking mama juana, which is what they call a vitamin drink or local "viagara". The rooms were absolutely wonderful, but the walls are kind of thin. No problem with beach chairs like in Riu Bambu, for example, where you had to wake up at 6 A.M. and reserve the beach chairs by putting towels on them. Here, there are more than enough of them.
reviews.title: Good place for the value

reviews.text: Cons: huge property, cannot walk from one end to another without taking a ride in one of the cars, which emit a very unpleasant odor from diesel fuel. I had to hold my breath in order not to enhale the toxins. Water bugs in the buffet and in the first floor hotel rooms. I guess this is OK for a tropical island, but you kind of don't want to see it there anyway (we've seen them in Riu Bambu too). We also saw mice running near the hotel lobby, not a pretty sight. They don't know how to make drinks very well in D.R., so I suggest to drink cognac, wine, or something that comes straight out of the bottle with no mixing involved. Big inconvinience are the card keys to get into your hotel room. Although they give you 2, one doesn't work almost right away and the other on the second day, so you can't get into your room when you need to and must wait for some one to come and let you in. There was no TV remote control in one of my relative's rooms. Stone and marble floors in the hotel rooms are very slippery, so be careful. No protective screen on the balcony door, so you can't keep the balcony door open while you sleep, because all the bugs are going to fly in. I have never seen a caribbean hotel room with no screen.
reviews.title: Stay at the Rui instead
Just "OK" - Nothing to write home about!
reviews.text: All in all, it was nice, much better than Riu Bambu, where the food is terrible. For people who have never been to the D.R., but have been to Aruba, Hawaii and other nicer islands, don't expect a 5 star hotel to be really a 5 star hotel. Don't forget that you are paying 3 times less to vacation there, so it is not that bad for the price.
I've travelled to dozens of resorts
reviews.title: Luxury and Relaxation

likes.disliked: — The size, but it feels smaller the more you get to know it

reviews.text: Good
reviews.title: ok
punta cana's beach lover
reviews.text: my 7th trips to punta cana, first time in bahia principe-punta cana

a-addtional charge for the safety deposit box in the room-$4.00/per day, which is total shock , ive been travel to many places(international) , this is the first time, n not to mentioned i booked with upgrade package called"club hacienda",still get charged,and we only found out when we check in, which is really not a "good" and "happy" surprise for our "vacation'

reviews.text: b-room cleaning-very poor, found"hair" in the bathtub, when i chk in the room, and never enough towels in the bathroom, few night i found no towel in the room after return a long hot day by the beach and pool. and wait for the clean towels before you could shower..
reviews.title: Perfect!!!

likes.liked: — Spacious, modern and clean with a great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: club hacienda-the pool towel wl be delivery into the room, it only found the pool towel first day, check in, usually i left the room very early to the pool and beach (towel station still no open yet), so i have to carry out the used pool towel n wait until the towel station open n exchange the clean towel)
reviews.title: No need to fear.. Bahia Principe is great!!

likes.disliked: — A/c only worked if you were in the room.

reviews.text: coffee maker with out coffee pot, for 6 days of my stayed , and finally i contact the club hacienda AGAIN", FINALLY they delivery the coffee pot and pool towel into my room, which only leave me one day to enjoy it, before my check out date.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort!!!........but....
would love to return
reviews.text: Just returned from Bahia Principe - had a great time!!!! The rooms are very clean, the people are extremely nice and the beach is probably the most gorgeous beach I have ever seen. They have 7 restaurants and the food is very good. The pools are clean, the help is wonderful. The only problem was the lack of attention by the bartenders at the pool bar. We told management and the problem was to be taken care of. The shopping is great.....overall - a great vacation and a great resort!!!!!! am planning for next year already!!

reviews.title: about Bahia Principe
reviews.text: We just returned from a week at the Bahia Principe. Just a few mentionables...the beach was beautiful; clean sand, plenty of chairs, and clear warm blue ocean water, although the last two days it was slightly rough and murky!

reviews.title: Pictures!! - Perfect holiday
reviews.text: The food was OK...some was delicious, and some not so!

reviews.title: You will love this resort
reviews.text: The Dominican people were wonderful; always happy! The rooms were large, beautiful, and very clean!

reviews.title: Loved the Bahia!! Loved Punta Cana
reviews.text: Just got back from Bahia Principe on monday. My boyfriend and I are 30 no children..........we had such a great time. Out of all the all-inclusives I have been to.....that was the best food. Never once got sick....the staff was wonderful. Its a huge resort. They have little trams going back and forth from the lobby to the beach. Great Idea. I was very impressed with the beach. You can walk forever if you want. Very fun relaxing vaction. We upgraded to the club rooms. We ended up on the hacienda side, instead of the club golden side which i had requested. There is not really a difference except the club golden rooms are closer to the beach. We stayed in villa 34 right in the middle of the hotel ....loved the location right in front of the pools and halfway point to everything. Worked out to be a way better spot then I thought. There really are not any oceanfront rooms except maybe villa 1.......Where ever they put you ..........you will loved it.....great hotel for families or couples or friends just going to have fun.......I would def go back..............happy traveling. :)

reviews.title: This resort will exceed your expectations
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Bahia Principe from April 9 to 16. I'm a media person and very picky. I found the resort exceeded our expectations on many levels. It's super clean, great food, great facilities and activities and a wonderful resort for families with young children. Everything is well thought out in terms of the resort's layout. Some patience and politeness will take you a long way in getting seven star service. The thing to remember is that absolutely nothing in life is perfect. We had a bathtub drain that was a little slow BIG DEAL!! and one other time we had to call twice to get fresh towels sent. I think that was the result of the language barrier. We found that learning a little spanish can help a lot. The people appreciate it and will go out of their way to please you. Also...do the decent thing and take some US one dollar bills and dole them out to the service people throughout the week. For about 30 dollars we experienced excellent service. Try to remember how lucky we are in the Western world and that we're on vacation in a beautiful place like Punta Cana. This was our third trip to Punta Cana and our best yet. I previously stayed at the Iberostar resort and was very happy but the Bahia Principe is definitely a few notchs higher. What are you waiting for....get on that plane!!!

My boyfriend and I just returned from our vacation this past Saturday. We stayed at the Bahia from Sat. April 9th thru Sat. April 16. Overall, the resort was beautiful and very clean. I have to admit, I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews, but we had an awesome time.
reviews.title: Gorgeous resort, had a blast despite a few problems during check in.!

reviews.text: Our only complaint was check-in, as many other trip advisor users have previously mentioned. Upon arrival at the hotel, we asked for a second or third floor room with hopes of steering clear of the mosquitos and since the hotel is so large and overwhelming, we thought we had a good deal with room 10308 on the third floor. When we finally arrived at our room at 4:30, (we had been at the hotel since 1pm) it was full of mosquitos. At this point, my boyfriend, who also works in the hospitality/hotel realm of business, called the front desk to request another room. We were told we could not switch rooms b/c there were no other units available and we would have to wait until morning. After a long day of traveling and waiting, i was annoyed and could not believe the hotel was completely full. After hours of being on hold, being transferred and actually going back to the lobby to speak with management, he was able to get us a new room. The catch was that it was an "upgrade" to the "Club Golden" rooms, which cost $20.00 more per day. Of course, we were upset to have to pay for the upgrade, as our room was unacceptable and it was not our fault that it was infested with mosquitos. In the end, it was worth it, yet the aggravation it caused that first afternoon was absolutely unnecessary. **A tip to any travelers reading this...upgrade to Club Golden before you leave...you get "top shelf liquor" (tanqueray, johnny walker, and smirnoff....which are better than the well stuff), a room closer to the beach/main pool, free internet access, towels in your room and 24hr room service.)
reviews.title: Nice trip!

reviews.text: Other than that, we had no other problems. The staff was friendly and helpful and tried very hard to speak English and to accomodate our every need. We tipped our maid and minibar refresher $1.00 each day and left lotions and creams for her to take home. Most nites, our bed was turned down for us after we came back from dinner and our new room was spotless and mostly mosquito free.
reviews.title: Very clean resort

reviews.text: The resort is huge but well organised and you never have the impression that it is over-crowded despite +4000 guests staying there (1880 rooms!). The pools however do get very busy and many people have the nasty habit of reserving their space early in the morning.

reviews.text: Grand Bahia Principe claims to be a 5 star resort but it is not. It is a strong 4 star compared to other 5 star hotels. You shouldn't expect to pay for the safe, the pool at the spa, the toiletries are basic....

reviews.text: The gym is a real let down. I tend to exercise daily and was looking forward to be able to do so during our stay. The gym is small, dark and damp and way too small for the size of the resort. The 2 rowers were broken, so was one of the treadmills and a few of the bikes. Despite reporting this to the manager nothing happened.
reviews.title: one of the nicest!

reviews.text: The summary is, if you're planning on going somewhere to do very little other than lay on the beach and relax, this is a GREAT place. If you're looking for nightlife and a bunch of exciting excursions - you need to look somewhere else.
reviews.title: Was a wonderful vacation!

reviews.text: First of all, the Bahia is a 4 star hotel, not a 5. Not to say it's not a nice one, but if you've been to the Mayan and stayed in a 5, you'll notice the difference.
reviews.title: Great Resort To Relax and Unwind
Tropical Paradise!!
reviews.text: While the resort IS huge, it never felt that way - the only crowds were at the main pool near the beach. I don't think we saw a chair open once during our week there. The trolley system is in place - though we never used it, nothing is THAT far, and it doesn't feel too too hot.

The rooms at the resort are very nice, much larger than the ones we were in last spring at the Mayan. Our Club Golden upgrade, honestly didn't get us THAT close to the beach or main pool - we were in Villa 08, but still a nice location, with a few nice extra 'perks'.
reviews.title: Mikado Japanese restaurant

reviews.text: We had a lovely time at the Gran Bahia Principe in Punta Cana, Dominican Republic. We flew Sky Service from Toronto the first week of July. The property is very large and requires transport buses to get around. It is divided into three hotels including the Punta Cana and the Bavaro (mirror images of each other) and the Club Premier. We stayed in the Bavaro side although the amenities are all the same. You can upgrade to the club golden when you get there. It costs $15US per night per person and includes a room closer to the beach, pretty well unlimited a la carte dinners, 15 minutes free internet in the internet "cafe" or free internet 24hours if you bring your own laptop. The upgrade was well worth it for us as we were able to get a room in Villa 1 which is right next to the beach and the main pool area off the beach. Within a 1 - 2 minute walk from the beach and pool were two large snack bars, two eat in restaurants for breakfast and lunch. The main buffet for dinner is in the main lobby building. Half way between the main lobby / restaurants and theatre building were two more pools. The main pools by the beach are divided into three sections with a swim up bar in one more geared to adults. There are bridges over the pool and zero pool entry for little kids and the disabled. All dinners - especially the A la carte require men to were long pants and collared shirts. Ladies should be nicely dressed as well.
reviews.title: Fun and Sun at the Gran Bahia Principe Punta Cana

likes.liked: — Very Clean and good size room - amazing bathroom.
likes.disliked: — Needed more water restocking in fridge. Much traffic on roads through property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are lots of shady areas to sit on the beach and get out of the hot sun. The sand is extremely soft and easy to walk on. The beach is very long and ideal to take long walks or to jog. The water is very warm and pretty calm - very mild waves. Later in the day, there is seaweed or sea grass that builds up in the tide and can be a bit messy. Early morning to mid afternoon is perfect swimming. There are lots of water sports - mostly included. There is a ship wreck off the coast and you can padel out and snorkel around it.
reviews.title: Perfect time at Bahia Principe

reviews.text: Lots of daily activities including dancing lessons, beach volleyball, bingo, etc.
reviews.title: Great time at the Bahia Principe

likes.liked: — Overall cleanliness and the convenience of the Club Hacienda upgrade.
likes.disliked: — Housekeeping service was good, but not always consistent.

reviews.text: Our two boys (age 8 and 12) went to the kids club for only two days near the end of the trip but really had a lot of fun. I think they wished that they had gone more days to the mini-club. There is a kids "disco" at 8pm and the main show starts at 9:45. The shows were quite good with excellent dancing and good singing. There is another later outdoor theatre in a large village square that starts at 11:00pm for adults. There are vendors ( a little pushy), small shops, a casino, a cigar shop, and a bar and disco. Perfect for couples or singles looking for night life.
reviews.title: Nice resort...very crowded, too many kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gardens are spectacular and beautifully manicured all the time. The facilities are spotless and very tastefully done. The people are lovely and try very hard to help. Tipping is appreciated - a few American Dollars at meal times.
reviews.title: Great resort, rocky start
Great holiday
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Club Bahia Principe for a week in December '04. We had a great time, our room was clean - spotless and was well kept by the maids daily (we left a $2.00 tip everyday) and always had clean towels in the bathroom, and towels made into swans or hearts with flower petals all over the bed. There were housecoats in the room to use as well as umbrellas(which we never needed) the weather was perfect. The service at the restaurants, and pool bars was good. We always left good tips as they worked very hard to make our trip enjoyable.

We ate at the Japanese restaurant twice, the steak house once (didn't like that very much), the international restaurant was good. The buffet at lunch is good they service hot dogs, hamburgers, pizza(really good). Didn't eat at the Mexican-no reason why really just didn't.
reviews.title: Here is the scoop!
Bahia Principe is great
reviews.text: The nightly entertainment on stage was good, it was something to do instead of going to the casino. The grounds are huge so they have shuttle golf carts and literally you just wave them down or wait at a station.

reviews.title: Good tips
reviews.text: There is a shopping plaza, good prices for silver, and the stuff you buy to bring home to people. I would strongly suggest not forgetting sunscreen,lotion,advil etc as in the store it is extremely expensive.ie: after sun lotion $20.00. I bought the same thing at home for $6.00 Cdn.

reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!!!!
reviews.text: The pools are clean and they have daily entertainment around the main pool every afternoon. The beach was clean,ocean warm and the service great. We went on a snorkling trip that was about 2 hours long, you dont need to go on a snorkling trip to see reef or fish though, just walk towards the flea market (looking out twards the ocean turn left) just past the rope that they have for the swimming area, go in the ocean there and you will see schools of fish go a little further and you will coral with all of its wildlife. I hopeif you decide to stay here you have a good time. We got what we were expecting, all we were worried about was the food, the weather and a great beach. All of which were met. We will go back to Dominican maybe not to Club Principle (as there are different areas of the island we would like to see) But we would stay at another Bahia Principe somewhere else.

reviews.title: Punta Cana's OK but we won't go back
reviews.text: This review is for the "poor man's" side of the Gran Bahai Principe. There is the Bavaro, which is an upgraded resort, next to the Punta Cana side. It's kind of like going to Disney World and having to stand in the long line because you didn't pick a hotel on the grounds...Everyone gets a color-coded wristband that IDs you as Punta Cana, Bavaro, Diamand Club, Premier, whatever. At the low end, certain pools, restaurants and bars are off-limits.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "All Inclusive" does mean bar pour and buffets. There are no round-the-clock snack options. There is no room service as advertised on the website. The theme restaurants were disappointing, but the buffet was adequate and eveyone found something to eat. I was disappointed in the quality of the fruit after going to Costa Rica, but others were raving over it. Get to the buffet early or risk waiting and missing out on many dishes. Drinks from the pool bar are light, unless you go for straight liquor.
reviews.title: Great hotel.Just what we expected.

likes.liked: — the friendly people,very clean,a big complex but it never felt crowded

reviews.text: It took everyone in our family awhile to figure out the maze that comprises the resort grounds. We were shooed off when we accidentally appeared at the Bavaro buffet instead of the Punta Cana's.

reviews.title: Just Bad Luck???

reviews.text: The rooms are large and very clean with your own balcony. Tip the maid and recieve top notch service, they work hard to keep your rooms clean(no musty smell ).

reviews.text: The facilities were sparkling clean, I never seen marble shine so much. There was not a piece of paper or cigerette butt on the grounds anywhere. The bathrooms were cleaned every hour and never had any odor. The grounds were amazing, flowers and greenery everywhere, gardeners at every building taking care of flowers and watering the grass. The walkways were always cleaned of debrie and washed regularly. The beach was wonderful!! Even crowded, you did not feel overwhelmed with people and always found a chair, no matter what time of day. The sand felt like baby powder with no shells and never too hot to walk in, the ocean was really warm and not a lot of seaweed. It was the most beautiful beach I have been on( been to cuba and peuto plata). The pools were great. the bartendars at the large pool were fabulous, always made great drinks and could get the party started, only the water by afternoon was really warm, would not cool you down. The smaller pool , centerly located was cooler with a swim up bar, great drinks, the bartenders were go around pool and give you drinks at your chairs,wow!!!
reviews.title: About what we expected

reviews.text: The food was very good, lots to chose from, something for everyone, your on vacation try something new! Only 2 from our party got sick but we believe that was a combination of drinks with coconut milk and different foods. My husband and I had everything even the cheese, great!! They even have heinz ketchup and mustard, really go all the way. We ate at the BBQ really good, Italian, was nice as well. We missed the mexican. You have to book a la carts as soon as you check in if you want a choice, we got what was left over!! However, we didn't mind the buffet. sometimes we ate at the take out in the peubleo principe by the disco.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the Bahia Principe. What a wonderful resort. We arrived at the airport on time and was at the resort and ready to enjoy by early afternoon. The check in and welcome all went smoothly. The lobby is gigantic, open and just beautiful. The drinks in the lobby bar were the best, try the rum punch. The rooms were immaculate. The grounds were very tropical and lush. We were in a villa close to the beach. The trolley service runs very regularly and can get you anywhere you want to go in this gigantic resort. The first morning there I took the map and did a walking tour of my own just to get acquainted with where everything is. It will take a day or two before you get the hang of where everything is located. The food is decent but we never expect anything great at an all-inclusive. There is a large variety of drinks and we sampled just about all of them. All delicious. The weather was gorgeous for 7 straight days. The beach is beautiful and even though it is the Atlantic Ocean the water is warm and very clear and blue. The pools are amazing with swim up bars and very warm
reviews.title: So Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little sceptical because of previous reviews I had read. When I got there I was blown away by the cleanliness, service and especially the staff. I do not speak spanish and was never not understood because of this. Some one had written that no one spoke english there and that is so false. We have to remeber that we are in a foreign country and so a little english is better than none. I also read that one guy was pissed off because he wanted to go to the quiet Ambar pool(adults only) and he was asked to leave. I think that is great because I paid extra $$$ for peace and quiet and got it. Don't be pissed off if you want to sneak in with out paying. There were a few rowdy Americans thinking the adult section was a Frat party so a few of us complainned at the front desk and they responded quickly in asking them to shut the hell up. The food was amazing including the restaurants(Don Pablo being the best). The only draw back is that the Ambar section is a little far removed from the evening entrtainment but a 10 minute walk or shuttle will get you there no problem. The Ambar section has its own Lunch area, private beach and pool. The Hotel is about 40 minutes from the airport. Air conditioned bus ride. Vendors on the beach are not aggressive and it is very safe to walk on the incredible and clean beach. I definately got what I paid for which was great!!!!!

reviews.text: To be quite honest, we were reluctant to travel to the Dom. Republic for our vacation. Let me tell you: we have been converted. The property is impecably clean. The rooms are very comfortable. The mini-bar is restocked every day with bottled water, soft drinks and beer. The grounds keepers are always at work trimming, planting, cleaning. The food at the buffet is above average (in comparison with other all inclusives). The à la carte restaurants was excellent. The beach was fabulous, although a little wavy - keep in mind that Hurricaine Dean was brewing in the vicinity.
reviews.title: Cannot Ask For Anything More

reviews.text: The best I saved for last: the staff. They were, without exception, tremendous. Everything they did, they did with a smile, with a dance in their step, with a true and heartfelt desire to please. They did everything "Con mucho gusto" - which is the phrase they used exclusively in response to a "Gracias." For those who don't speak Spanish, it means "with much pleasure."

reviews.text: food was horrible...mostly all buffet which was bad quality. they limit the amount of reservations u can make at a restuarant on the property. i stayed for 3 nights and they only allowed me one reservation, but when i went to make a reservation evrything was booked!! they finally got me into a restaurant and there were like 20 tables empty!!! so i dont know whay they said everything was booked. not that it made a difference anyway bcuz the food was just as bad as the buffet food. all the drinks/liquor are watered down. the beer is not true dominican beer like PRESIDENTE. the service was just ok. the a/c doesnt cool enough and there in so a/c in the lobby or propety. the restaurants do not have good a/c/ either. same exact food day after day. all in all will not recommend it and will not go back. if you are picky like I am, DO NOT spend your $ here.

reviews.text: Me and 4 friends stayed at the Bahia Principe Punta Cana from July 15th to the 22nd/07 for my stagette/bachelorette. We all read dozens of reviews (good and bad) but in the end I found this resort to be AMAZING!! The resort itself is beautiful, the gounds were constantly being groomed, our rooms were clean, spacious and had extra amenities like a jacuzzi tub included. The mini bar was constantly being refilled but the fridge in itself wasnt very cold but the ice machine was just a few steps away and was always full.
reviews.title: had an awesome time!

Note that though there are signs everywhere about not saving seats, most of the prime positions were "saved" by 9am. So if you cant beat 'em, join 'em!

Loved the Gran Bahia Principe
reviews.text: Eight of us traveled to the Gran Bahia Principe from February 4-11. This is the first time ever that we arrived at our hotel and we were already checked in. We received all our information on the new, air condititioned bus on our way to the hotel. As soon as we arrived we made sure our bags were located and we were taken to the main buffet for lunch. We have traveled to the Bahia Principe in the Myan Riviera so we were well aware of the size and cleanliness and the friendly staff of the resort. We traveled with another couple who had never been to an all inclusive resort and they absolutely loved it and wondered why they took so long to take one of these vacations. We on the other hand, usually travel each year to an all inclusive and know the good and bad of these resorts. Except for one a la carte restaurant there is absolutely nothing I can think of that made our stay unpleasant. The staff can't help you enough and will do anything for you without making you feel you have to tip them. Many staff members however do not speak any English but they do try and will find someone who will. I can speak some Spanish and did not have any problems. Overall the resort is extremely clean, food was very good and we never had to wait in line at the buffet. We were located in building 30 (diamond club) about a five minute walk to one of the larger pools by the ocean. We never had difficulty finding shade or chairs, mind you we did place our towels down by 7 am. The nightly entertainment was average. They do try however to make everyone laugh and enjoy themselves. The children did not want to go to the kids club this year as they felt they were older and they had lots of fun on the beach playing soccer. I would totally ignore comments about bad food and musty smells because the food is quite good and a lot of variety. There is a musty smell but what else can you expect when the temperatures are hot and it rains. Enjoy and relax. We did!

We just returned on Saturday Feb 17th from two beautiful weeks at this hotel. We had a wonderful vacation however I was slightly disappointed because I had set higher expectations than I should have, from reading the reviews here. There is nothing seriously wrong with this hotel. It’s a great resort but it does have some minor annoyances and because of it’s size, it will not suit everyone. I’ll detail this further below.
reviews.title: 4 Star (Not 5) Hotel And Big!
Great Hotel
reviews.text: First off let me start this review with explaining my travel experience. My wife and I have traveled extensively in the Caribbean to many islands. We have also been to Europe and throughout the US and Canada. Our experience with accommodations has been everything from a cabin that had a cold water gravity shower with crawling bugs everywhere – and we’ve still had a great time – to boat cruises on the Windjammer, individual small hotels, and all inclusive resorts but never anything to this scale. I generally am quite happy if we have running water to shower and bed that has clean sheets once a week.

reviews.title: Bahia Principe, PC - Review
reviews.text: My comments in no particular order:

1)This hotel is BIG. 1536 rooms. Actually the logistics behind this place is amazing. Think about 1536 rooms over several acres. There is likely anywhere from 4,000 to 6,000 people on this resort staying or working here. The food required and it’s preparation, maintenance, water, power consumption. It boggles the mind. We never had any issues with water or power and that is rare during our travels. In fact I think the water pressure and amount of hot water is superior to my home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend were at the Bahia Prinicipe Punta Cana from 9/10/06 - 9/16/06 and booked our travel through Cheap Carribbean.com. That was great and we didn't have any problems. We flew from Birmingham, Alabama - Charlotte, NC then on to Punta Cana. We arranged for the roundtrip transfer and that worked out great as well. Check in went smoothly and we were in building 9000 and didn't upgrade to gold. We had no problems and had 3 ala carte dinners, which was more than enough. The room was nice and clean and had flowers. We brought an extra plastic little card to keep in the air conditioning going when we weren't there so we wouldn't have to leave the door key in there. I also suggest the safe in the room (about $26), it's worth it. Our fridge was stocked with water, beer (Bahamian), and sodas (Pepsi, 7Up, and Orange Fanta). We were on the 3rd floor and there are no elevators, but that wasn't a problems since the bellhop carried the bags up and we could use the exercise. Be sure to bring $1's for tips, it's not needed but appreciated. I also bought small gifts for housekeeping (makeup, hair accessories, etc) and left them with a tip. The grounds are gorgeous - flowers are wonderful and not a bit of trash anywhere. Even though there is a trolley that will take you back and forth to the lobby/buffet and pool, the walk isn't bad at all and we never rode the trolley. It was nice to take a stroll and good exercise. The pool area was nice, but we never used it. We stayed on the beach the entire time. We never had trouble getting chairs and it never seemed to crowded. There were good waves and it was very relaxing. The drinks were good (the Mama Juana, Bahia Prinicpe, and Pina Colada) and the food was good. The service was OUTSTANDING. Luisa in the lobby bar area was great. We ate breakfast a couple of morning at the main lobby buffet, and they had a great selection. The other days we ate at the buffet at the Pescador restaurant, which was convenient to going to the beach. Lunch we had at the Las Olas snack bar and the Piscis, and both had a good selection. For dinner, we ate at the lobby buffet 3 nights and the selection was very good. We could always find something we liked. We chosed the Garden Grill (steak), The Italian restaurant, and the Japanese for our ala carte meals. It was probably a tie between the Italian and Steak for the best food. Both were very, very good. The Japanese was good - it was they type like Benihana where they cook in front of you. All were good experiences. We spent a lot of time in the evening relaxing in the lobby having a couple of drinks and listening to music. The setting was perfect. We also took in 2 shows at the theater. They were very entertaining. It wasn't Vegas, but we weren't in Vegas. They tried very hard to entertain. We also took an excursion with Safari tours - it was an all day tour and it was great because it was only 5 couples, so we definitely got individual attention. We got to see the real Punta Cana and countryside. We stopped at an elementary school and they sang us a song (good idea to bring something for the kids - candy/school supplies like pencils, paper, etc. You can get at the dollar store). We stopped at some tourist stores, then on to a ranch. They had hammocks and our guide Julio explained some of the different fruits/plants. Then we went horseback riding. That was a little scary b/c I've never done it before, but it was fun. We then went further into the mountains and to a family's house. We saw how coffee was made and a cock fight. Then had a great lunch. We then went to Macaw (sp?) beach, which was very pretty. We purchased the video from the trip, which was great. It was sad to leave, but I would definitely come back. We had no trouble getting back to the airport, definitely allow enough time since they are very diligent about security and double and triple check your bags. It's also very hot in the airport since it's open air. Overall, great trip!

The room is comfortable and the shower is very good. However, the air conditioned system barely works. If you don't tip the maid, you don't get towels! Renting a safe in your room is a must but it costs $30 US. It is simply abusing the tourists.
Food is not very good, certainly not as good as other 5 starts we went on other islands of the Carribean. However, we did not get sick, but were careful with meals.

What I can't figure out is how anyone could complain about this hotel? The grounds are immaculate. The hotel lobby, restaurants etc,. are breathtaking. Everything is marble or granite. You really feel like you are in Paradise. The size of this resort did not bother us in the least. As a matter of fact that was one of the things we liked about it. I like the fact that things are somewhat spread out. I also liked the style of the Villas versus a high rise style complex. It felt more tropical!! The trolley takes you back and forth from the Lobby to the beach with stops in between. It is actually quite enjoyable and you never have to wait more than 1 minute to catch one.

reviews.text: The maids were really great! The rooms were cleaned everyday and they always left flowers on the towels and beds etc,. You would see them early in the morning cutting flowers off the shrubs so they could leave them in the rooms. Very friendly. I would leave a couple $$ everyday along with small gifts we brought from home. She always left us lots of water and drinks in our fridge. Loved the jacuzzi bathtub.

reviews.title: Awesome, Awesome, Awesome
reviews.text: The people in the Dominican are some of the friendliest people we've ever met. Always smiling and singing!! The staff at the Bahia were amazing. When your eating at the Buffet they are there right away to take your drink order and fill your glass as soon as it's empty. I've heard people complain that they only spoke Spanish and couldn't communicate. The employees at the Lobbys and Restaurants, bars spoke english/french and multiple languages. The others sometimes did not, but you could usually get your point across. Not an issue. If they came here, would you be able to speak Spanish to them? You are in their country and they speak Spanish!! Deal with it and make the most of it. Very friendly so it was never a problem.
As far as the food goes we loved the Buffet. We enjoyed the food there more so than the A la Carte restaurants.

reviews.title: exceptional except for small beds
reviews.text: My husband and I with our two daughters stayed at club diamond Gran Bahia Principe Dec.17-31/06. This was our fifth trip to this beach, and the only resort we will return to- under conditions. People with children should be aware that king-sized beds are available only in rooms with one bed and something they call a sofa which is really a hard mattress on a wooden frame. There is no such thing as a pull-out couch or a roll-in cot. We had two double beds and the weird couch. If we wanted a larger bed, we had to pay $140 U.S. per night so our girls could have an added room. No way! We were led to believe that Club Diamond would put us near the beach, but we were closer to the reception and had to use the tram if we wanted to go back to our room for something. The Club Diamond lounge is a large office with too much air-conditioning, a small bar, two computers that are always in use, and the desks for the Club Diamond staff. Who would want to socialize there when on a sun holiday? Unfortunately, we spent hours there for the first four days, trying to get a better room. The head woman was on leave, and MARTIN, her replacement, would not help us. The woman returned on the fourth morning and immediately gave us a room near the beach. Mind you, by this time I had called my travel agent back in Halifax and she had worked hard to help. At least we got a third-floor room near the beach and not a second-floor room overlooking a construction site. Double beds and that weird couch, though. Before we left we collected e-mail addresses and phone numbers from everyone in any position to help with our next trip. Two discoveries: as a repeater we can book our trip and then e-mail the hotel directly to choose our room, which includes an add-on room in the price; there are extra rooms not numbered outside the villa which are kept for dissatisfied people. Our second room was empty for the whole time we were trying to get moved!

Now, here are the reasons we will return (with our rooms guaranteed in writing); the food in all the restaurants was great, the complex is clean and new, the staff is well trained and effecient, the children's club has a full-day schedule, all amenities are abve-averege, the pools are numerous- basically, it's a great place.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised, Would Definitely Reccomend!

We went to the Japanese, Gardern Grill and Italian. The service was very, good.....We stayed in 73 villa which was on the right side, in the middle. We spent most days at the beach then pool, the pools however seemed to have a lot of teeny boppers, drunk ones, which was a bit of a turn-off, but we never had too much problem finding a lounger. The entertainment was great, we saw the Michael Jackson and the Grammy show. The best part was the excursion to the Saona Island.....which was an extra $98 but well worth it. I would probably come back with my kids, because it was family friendly. The maid service was good, nothing extra for us, was hoping for one cool towel animal on my bed, but no such luck, lol. I would give it a 7/10.

reviews.text: We just returned from a week long trip to this resort and have mixed feelings. Lets start with the things that we didn't really like... it is too big and long. We were so far away from the beach, had to take a shuttle down. You could only book 3 nights at the nice (good) restuarants. The rest of the time we were stuck at eatting at the one buffet designated for our section and it was the same food all the time. There was a snack buffet by the beach (but it had less and wasn't good). By the end of the week I was just eatting fruit. This made for a long trip. Expecailly when you are used to good southern food, the food just didn't cut it. And there was not place with around the clock food, like other resorts and cruises. We were disappointed by that. There wasn't much to do either. All the exersions were expensive. The beach was crowded with lounge chairs. Had to use bottled water to brush our teeth, since they say the water isn't that good to use. The soft drinks were all flat or too sweet.

reviews.text: The property was very nice, new and well kept. We liked the room. The one exersion we did we liked, to swim with sharks and stingrays, that was memorable. the pools on the property were nice and big. The water was nice, but kind of cold. The 3 resturants you could book were good food, we ate at the steak house(Garden Grill), I don't know if it was so good because the other was so bad but it was the best! The mexican meal was good and then we ate at the Japanese steak house and all was good except the beef, it was SO tough. Overall we were able to get away, relax and enjoy time with family.

reviews.text: LOBBY/CHECK IN: The resort lobby is beautiful. You are greeted with a drink in an open air lobby full of marble. I had emailed before we left requesting a room close to the beach on an upper floor. When we got to the check in, I again asked for this. We were upgraded to Diamond Club for no charge. We were told this is normally $30 per day more, per person, so we were excited. Our room was not ready, so we had a drink in the lobby and came back 30 minutes later. This time we were given our keys and the bellboy drove us to our room. We tipped the guy at check in (Junior) $20 for all of his help.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I travelled to Punta Cana from the 1st to the 8th of June to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. Now, my husband had alot of requirements for our vacation, as he is the most pickiest person and complains about everything...but we found a winner. He loved it. The island, the resort, the people (the fact that he could pretty much smoke anywhere on the premisis excluding the restaurants of course), Room service being a major requirment for him, Dining choices were all delicious - you must eat at the Japanese and Italian restaurant. Those were my favorite, buffet great as well...Trip was amazing.
reviews.title: My husband loved it, that says everything!

reviews.text: We upgraded our stay to the Royal Golden section of the resort (closest to the beach on Punta Cana side) and loved it. Worth every extra penny. Service throughout whole resort was over and beyond anything we have ever experienced before. The lobby bar's and the buffet restaurant service were the best. We would order a drink, and as we were waiting for it to arrive, we would be offered by other wait staff at least 3-4 times if we would like a drink. The ratio of wait staff to vacationers honestly felt like 3 to 1. You were doted on constantly. Never a rude comment or gesture, very kind and courteous.
reviews.title: Fantastic, Relaxing All-Inclusive Week

reviews.text: One thing I must note, at the Casino, this was not the case. The ladies working there, especially at the black jack table were very snooty and rude. Constantly speaking in spanish to one another and laughing right in the patrons faces. Not impressed, even though visited the casino every night, and felt great that walked out after the end of the week ahead of what I began with. I think their attitudes really made every dollar I walked away with more enjoyable to count. Haven't even spent it, just keeping it until my next trip to Punta Cana, this Saturday.
reviews.title: Gran Bahia is certainly GRAND!!

reviews.text: This was our fourth trip to the Dom Rep, having previously stayed in Riu and Iberostar hotels which we consider to be much better. This hotel is vast, some might say too big and is still expanding. The apartments are set out in attractive gardens giving the impression of a town rather then a hotel. Our apartment was about a 10 to 15 minute walk to the reception/bar areas. Cars pulling tailers ferry people to and from the reception area from other parts of the complex. Beware, if it rains during the evening you will get very wet when going to eat or drink. We found the food to be below the standard you would expect and the choice very limited. It was often served up cold. The snack bars around the beach area had a very limited menu and did not change thoughout our two week stay. The main buffets were situated on the other side of the complex in the reception, if you were on the beach this involved a lot of hassle so people mainly eat in the snack bars during the day. The room was ok but not as clean as we would expect, often when we returned in the late afternoon we found the towels had not been replaced we would then phone and wait anything up to an hour for clean ones. During the evenings entertainment consided of a singer/pianist in the lobby bars, again the same music every night. Each night they had a show in the theatre which ran for an hour. These were put on by the entertaiment team and consisted mainly of dance routines. The big downside for us was the seating. Most of the chairs were set out like a cinema, very few tables, the drinks were served in small plastic throw away cups. Not conducive to a social evening out. The beach is great,, flat white sand and very long. The European habit of saving sun beds with towels has caught on and if you arrive on the beach later then 8am you may have problems finding one. Compared to other hotels we have been to in the Dominican Republic the overall consensus of our party of four was one of disapointment..
